intro: Teucrium ronnigeri subsp. ronnigeri, commonly known as Ronniger's germander, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb characterized by its aromatic, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs such as mint and oregano. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
